Question: When Pang telephoned the next day, Ono told her this person was unavailable, being exhausted after a hypnotherapy session.
Hints: This person first met Paul McCartney at the Quarrymen's second performance, held in Woolton on 6 July at the St.
While **** was recording Mind Games (1973), he and Ono decided to separate.
In 1973, this person contributed a limerick called "Why Make It Sad To Be Gay?" to Len Richmond's The Gay Liberation Book.
